page.title: 10Carlisle Civic Centre
page.content: Built in 1964 on a Rickergate site once the bed of a loop in the River Eden, the Civic Centre is Carlisle's only "tower block".(The hero of BBC TV drama serial "Fell Tiger", broadcast 1985, abseiled down it!) You reach the top of its ten storeys /135 feet in 36 seconds in one of three lifts, or by climbing 220 stairs. About 400 employees use 23 computers, 600 telephones, and 9 safes, working in these{departments}: Architects, Building Surveyors, Leisure Services, Personnel, Social Services,Magistrates Offices, Computers, Town Clerk's, City Treasurer's, and Housing. Most work a 37 hour week and clock in and out. The public make enquiries & pay rents and rates on the ground floor.City council meetings are held in an octagonal chamber next door to the Civic Centre.
